intro: Alcea excubita, commonly known as the nightshade alcea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in the evening. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft texture. Alcea excubita is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
